intro: Gymnadenia camptoceras, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to August. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves that are arranged in a rosette at the base, with a tall flowering stem that can reach up to 60 centimeters in height. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and woodlands. Gymnadenia camptoceras is often found in open habitats and is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
